oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Education about organic food and sustainability in Denmark, Finland, Italy and Norway: Findings from the iPOPY project
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roos, Gun
Mikkola, Minna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Education, extension and communication
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report presents results from “Work Package 4: Consumer perceptions, practices and learning” of the “innovative Public Organic food Procurement for Youth – iPOPY” project. The report gives an overview of organic food and sustainable development within national core curriculum and examples of education about organic food and sustainability in the participating European countries: Denmark, Finland, Italy and Norway.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: SIFO - National Institute for Consumer Research
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Roos, Gun and Mikkola, Minna (2010) Education about organic food and sustainability in Denmark, Finland, Italy and Norway: Findings from the iPOPY project. SIFO - National Institute for Consumer Research, Oslo, Norway.
